titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stanford Parents' Club Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Stanford University Archives staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: The records include minutes, 1923-2007; records pertaining to fellowships, scholarships and awards, 1957-1969; a history notebook, 1924-1973; scrapbooks, 1930-1985; records concerning the Chrysanthemum Party (annual fund raiser), 1963-1989; files pertaining to the Men's Rest Home,1931-1945, and the Women's Rest Home, 1928-1945; and miscellaneous financial records, publicity materials, and membership records, 1933-2009.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: The records were received by the University Archives via administrative transfers from the Stanford Parents' Club in 1981, 1993, 1996, 1997, 1998, 2001, and 2009.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: Portions of this collection contain protected health information (PHI) as defined by the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPPA) of 1996. Access is therefore restricted. Patrons who wish to access materials from this collection must consult the Special Collections and University Archives Access to Health Information of Individuals Policy at http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/access_to_health_policy.pdf.
The collection is otherwise open for research; materials must be requested at least 48 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Stanford Parents' Club records (SC0261). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Stanford Parents' Club, first organized in 1923 as the Stanford Mothers' Club, provides financial and social assistance to Stanford students; from 1924 to 1962 they operated student convalescent facilities known as Rest Homes.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The records include minutes, 1923-2007; records pertaining to fellowships, scholarships and awards, 1957-1969; a history notebook, 1924-1973; scrapbooks, 1930-1985; records concerning the Chrysanthemum Party (annual fund raiser), 1963-1989; files pertaining to the Men's Rest Home,1931-1945, and the Women's Rest Home, 1928-1945; and miscellaneous financial records, publicity materials, and membership records, 1933-2009.

did.unittitle: Rest Home regulations and miscellaneous reports and correspondence
Form letters to parents of students with programs of club activities
History of the Club by Marian Hall and correspondence pertaining to club history
"Campus Cavalcade" by Dorothy Nichols [pageant on University's history]
Notebooks containing lists, reports, clippings, fliers, financial records, photographs, and correspondence pertaining to the annual Chrysanthemum Party
Publicity materials (copies of press releases and clipping)
Three scrapbooks containing clippings, brochures, photographs, reports, fliers, and other items on the activities of the Club
Articles of Incorporation and By-Laws of the Mothers Club
Benefits money handling: Chrysanthemum Party, 1975-1986; Designer Doorways, 1987
1940s Letters; Foreign Letters; Tours; Mothers Club Sections.
Regarding Admissions Tax ($.01 for each $.05 collected)
Pictures (Mrs. Ann Sterling) and reply from Mrs. Edmund Brown
Financial Accounting for Benefits, etc. given
Loose clippings and pictures, miscellaneous letters and reports
Packet of Correspondence Notes (over many years), Mrs. (Governor) Edmund G. Brown and others
Picture of Ray Lyman Wilbur (President of Stanford,
Originals of the 1977 spring mailing - Letter and Program (mock up before the days of computers, etc.)
President Rosenna Yau's file - front matter
President Rosenna Yau's file - Friends of H & S
President Rosenna Yau's file - job descriptions
President Rosenna Yau's file - members and past presidents
Publications - includes Gourmet Recipes from Early Days in California 1891-1991 in Honor of the Stanford Centennial
Presidents' letters and enclosures (Elzene Yancey, Dee Heinze, Eleanor Torgerson, B. J. Darrow, Bernice Holubar, Helen Seethaler)
Video: Stanford at the Crossroads: with President Donald Kennedy and Trustee George Hume
Listing of the Board of Directors
Taste of Red and White Notebook
Dessert social with President and Mrs. Clinton

scopecontent.p: This folder also includes a memo from the Stanford Parents Club dated November 2009, which clarifies that the By-laws and Amendments to Articles of Incorporation stapled to the Certificate of Amendment of Articles of Incorporation in this folder were never officially adopted.

did.unittitle: Financial Report and Board of Directors

scopecontent.p: This folder also includes a memo from the Stanford Parents Club dated November 2009, which clarifies that the By-laws and Amendments to Articles of Incorporation filed under August 1999 in this folder were never officially adopted.
